meta.description: Here are the Top 50 Natural Medicine Sites For Living a Healthy Life. The Complete Herbal Guide was listed as one of the best herbal websites to go to...

title: Top 50 Natural Medicine Sites For Living a Healthy Life
cleaned_text:
If you are interested in natural medicine, alternative medicine, holistic medicine, and other aspects of healthy, natural living (like chiropractic care), then you know that there are essentially countless websites and blogs on the subject, but which resources are truly the cream of the crop?

Read on to discover who we chose as the 50 BEST natural medicine websites!

Alternative Medicine has been an industry-leading magazine for years, and its online content is just as information-rich and fascinating as the magazine itself. Learn tons about healthier eating and natural ways to help you stay fit and ward off illness. Be sure to check out all of their health tips!

Posts that we love:

 1. Exercise May Shield Against The Health Fallout Of A Weeklong of Overeating

 2. Stimulating the Brain Makes Exercising the Legs Feel Easier

 3. Natural Approaches to a Healthier Prostate

Natural Medicines is one of our favorite resources on the web for dietary supplements, natural medicines, and complementary alternative & integrative therapies. Also, an incredible resource for anyone interested in learning about medication interactions, effectiveness, and adverse effects. Be sure to subscribe to unlock all of their premium services.

Posts that we love:

 1. What is Cupping?

 2. Cocoa Compound Reduces Appetite

 3. Resveratrol Improves Hormone Levels in Women with PCOS

Perhaps the most active, consistently updated natural medicine website on the entire internet. Check back daily to discover new content on every alternative medicine & healthy living topic you can possibly imagine, written by respected industry experts.
• 15 Reasons You Should Be Drinking Lemon Water Every Morning

Dr. Ed Group, the creator of Global Healing Center, is a pioneer in the field of natural healing and has made it his life’s mission to spread the word of health and wellness to the global community.

Posts that we love:

 1. Healthy Vegan Peanut Butter Cups Recipe

 2. Best Vitamins and Minerals for Hair Growth

 3. Understanding the Alkaline Diet and Its Benefits

Prevention is easily one of our favorite healthy living blogs, featuring smart and helpful articles, from topics as wide-ranging as food recipes, beauty, sex, mind-body, and weight loss. Prevention also offers a lovely online shop, with high-quality beauty & skincare products, cooking tools, fitness equipment, and more.

Posts that we love:

 1. 5 Stomach Problems That Are Way More Normal Than You Think

 2. 6 Moves To Master A Pull-Up In 8 Weeks

 3. 5 Types Of Anti-Aging Foods You Should Already Be Eating

Underground Health is a leader in alternative medicine info and alternative health news. They uncover health-related news stories that won’t show up in the mainstream media and are there to help people understand the value of alternative medicine and healthy eating.

Posts that we love:

 1. Is Diet Soda Really Bad for You?

 2. The Health Benefits and Uses of Thyme Oil

 3. The 5 Major Health Benefits of Drinking Peppermint Tea

Alternative Medicine Zone is your one-stop website for tons of excellent content on alternative health & treatments, herbal medicines, alternative medicines, yoga, massage therapy, and much more, presented in easy-to-read and enjoyable articles.

Posts that we love:

 1. The Top 5 Benefits of Bhringraj Oil

 2. The Complete Beginner’s Guide to Iridology

 3. Healthy living with Bio Resonance Therapy

Started by holistic nutritionist Joy McCarthy, Joyous Health has truly blossomed into one of our favorite go-to blogs for healthy living! Topics range from fitness & wellness to beauty, to inspiration, all the way to mama & baby. Be sure to join Joy’s online community to receive the full benefit of her excellent website!

Posts that we love:

 1. Peanut Butter vs. Almond Butter

 2. Five Exercises for Mom and Baby

 3. How to Make a Better (and Healthier) Cup of Coffee

The University of Maryland deserves a ton of credit for creating such a bountiful resource on all topics regarding complementary and alternative medicines. Learn basically everything there is to know about herbs, supplements (and their interactions), treatments, and conditions.

Posts that we love:

 1. Medical Encyclopedia

 2. Drug Interaction Tool

 3. Complementary and Alternative Medicine Guide

The Complete Herbal Guide is one of our all-time favorite websites on the topic of healing herbs. Updated daily, The Complete Herbal Guide offers a cornucopia of information on subjects including alternative medicine, vitamins & supplements, and how to live healthily. Includes many interviews with experts and thought leaders.

Posts that we love:

 1. 10 Must Do Exercises This Fall

 2. 12 Tips for Healthy Holiday Eating

 3. Top 25 Foods That Make Your Skin Radiant and Glowing

MedlinePlus is the National Institutes of Health’s website for patients and their families and friends. Produced by the National Library of Medicine, the world’s largest medical library, it brings you information about diseases, conditions, and wellness issues in language you can understand. MedlinePlus offers reliable, up-to-date health information for all, free of charge.

Posts that we love:

 1. Herbal Medicine

 2. Drugs, Herbs, and Supplements

 3. Medical Encyclopedia

GreenMedInfo is dedicated to providing evidence-based natural medical information. Through their easy to navigate and attractive site, GreenMedInfo provides physicians, healthcare practitioners, clinicians, researchers, and consumers a resource to determine the therapeutic value of vitamins, minerals, herbs, and foods.

Posts that we love:

 1. The Mystic (Growing) Inside You

 2. How to Reverse Heart Disease with the Coronary Calcium Score

 3. Why Social Isolation Leads to Inflammation

Jill started Jill’s Home Remedies in 2011 to share with the world all the fun and educational things she has learned regarding natural health. As a sickly child with few answers from doctors, Jill discovered that natural remedies made her feel best, and now she hopes that others can follow in her footsteps toward a healthier life.

Posts that we love:

 1. Homemade Astragalus Bone Broth

 2. 3 Delicious Ways To Add Chickweed To Your Diet

 3. Teaching Kids to Eat Wild

Kristina Amelong, the creator of the Optimal Health Network, offers easy-to-use alternative health resources to the community. She provides effective lifestyle tools that assist people to create individualized health programs. The alternative health tools she recommends include colon cleansing, a fasting diet, and detox diets.

Posts that we love:

 1. Scientific Literature Absolutely Supports the Use of Enema Treatments

 2. Spring Cleanse: What Is The Best Way To Detox?

 3. Essential Oil Use Holds Promise in Lowering Our Need for Antibiotics

Nat Med Talk is perhaps the most active alternative health forum on the web, with over 11,000 members and over 76,000 posts. Chat about anything you can think of within the realm of natural medicine (and anything even remotely related), and you can be sure that you will find other individuals to share and discuss these topics with.

Kate, the Modern Alternative Mama, is a busy woman, When she isn’t off being a wife and mommy to 5 children, she is busy maintaining Modern Alternative Mama, a great blog, particularly for moms who are looking to raise their families with natural, healthy choices.

Posts that we love:

 1. How to Make Pumpkin Puree

 2. Should Healthy Kids Take Supplements?

 3. Herbal Profile: Lavender

Founded by Deirdre Layne all the way back in 1999, Earth Clinic is one of the original, awesome natural health websites on the web. Earth Clinic has consistently been ranked among the world’s top sites for Alternative and Integrative Medicine for well over a decade and is still an excellent place to learn about tried-and-true natural remedies.

Posts that we love:

 1. Turmeric Healing Power

 2. Remedies, Herbs, Vitamins, Minerals, and Supplements

 3. Apple Cider Vinegar in Neti Pot Helping Sinus Infection

MindBodyGreen brings together leaders in the wellness world, best-selling authors, fitness experts, trusted healers, pioneering doctors, top chefs, celebrities, and top-tier journalists to give you the freshest, most in-the-know content and tools to help you live your healthiest, happiest life, all published on an attractive looking website.

Posts that we love:

 1. How I Healed My Chronic Hip Pain Naturally

 2. Yes, Running Can Help You Get Over A Broken Heart. Here’s How

 3. The Sunniest Wellness Escape You Can Take This Holiday Season

Spine-health.com was started in August 1999 by Peter F. Ullrich, Jr., MD and Stephanie Burke, with a shared goal of providing intelligent, unbiased and highly relevant medical information and community support for people dealing with a wide range of pain conditions and related issues, such as back pain, arthritis, fibromyalgia, depression, osteoporosis, sleep disorders, exercise, diet and more.

Posts that we love:

 1. 3 Simple Ways to Indulge Your Spine

 2. 3 Techniques for Coping with Chronic Sciatica

 3. 2 Reasons Why Walking Is Good for Your Lower Back

Founded in 1998, The National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health is the Federal Government’s lead agency for scientific research on the diverse medical and health care systems, practices, and products that are not generally considered part of conventional medicine, and conducts research to help answer important scientific and public health questions about complementary health approaches.

Posts that we love:

 1. Hypnosis for Medical Purposes

 2. Building a Foundation for Clinical Trials of Natural Products

 3. Enhancing Scientific Literacy and the Understanding of Clinical Research

Dr. David Brownstein is a family physician and is one of the foremost practitioners of holistic medicine. He is the Medical Director of the Center for Holistic Medicine in West Bloomfield, MI. Dr. Brownstein has lectured internationally to physicians and others about his success in using natural hormones and nutritional therapies in his practice.

Posts that we love:

 1. Why Would Anyone Get the Flu Vaccine?

 2. Mercury Fillings: Toxic Material That Should Be Banned

 3. More Shocking Vaccine News: Weed Killer Found in More Vaccines

In 1995, in the days before the Internet became popular, a few Chiropractors decided to create a website where Chiropractors would work toward providing the best information and communication possible for the Chiropractic profession. That site is The Chiropractic Resource Organization and it’s still going strong to this day.

Posts that we love:

 1. The Chiropractic Scope of Practice in the United States

 2. Commonly Used Meridian Points

 3. Mechanisms of Low Back Pain: A Guide for Diagnosis and Therapy

Janet Starr Hull created Healthy News to educate, stimulate, and motivate as many people as she can. Healthy News is here to provide the answers that most people cannot find in the traditional medical channels and to enlighten the spirit in those seeking to regain their health and wellness.

Posts that we love:

 1. Why Your Hair Thins Before Winter

 2. How Food Makes You Feel Good

 3. How to Know if You Are High in Mercury

Beyond Meds documents and shares many natural methods of self-care for finding and sustaining health in body, mind, and spirit. This blog also deals with wider issues in the political and spiritual realms as they pertain to mental health and human rights issues surrounding psychiatry.

Posts that we love:

 1. Help for insomnia…

 2. Aromatherapy is being scientifically studied

 3. Fight or flight? Try FIGHTING. Kickboxing scratches that itch.

Chiro One Wellness Centers are Chicagoland-based chiropractic care centers founded in 1992. More than that, they are now an active leader in the online space, offering a plethora of valuable information on a much broader scale of subjects than just chiropractic, including nutrition, mental well-being, family health, and sports medicine.

Posts that we love:

 1. The Relationship Between Stress and Good Fats

 2. Patient Success Story: High Blood Pressure

 3. How to Exercise in Cold Temps and Reap its Benefits

Katerina Baratta is the founder of Della Terra Wellness, the prime destination for women who want to live up to their healthiest, most vibrant, and well-balanced potential, naturally. Positive, inspirational, and useful blog content abounds on Della Terra, and the site has been featured on many best of the web lists and major publications.

Posts that we love:

 1. A Sneaky Way to Make Any Meal More Nutritious

 2. Chinese Medicine is SO Much More than Acupuncture



Lynn Jaffee, a creator of Acupuncture Health Insights, is a licensed practitioner of acupuncture and Chinese medicine and the author of the book, Simple Steps: The Chinese Way to Better Health, a clear and concise explanation of Chinese medicine. AHI offers a wealth of information on acupuncture and Chinese medicine.

Posts that we love:

 1. The Cold Truth About Being Cold

 2. The Healing Wisdom of Plants

 3. Are Chinese Herbs Safe?

Tucked away on a website about Saratoga, New York, is a surprisingly excellent natural living blog, called Living Well, and believe us, the information provided is useful for everyone, not just residents of Saratoga. Maintained by an experienced holistic physician and a licensed Aesthetician.

Posts that we love:

 1. Healthy Bodies and Happy Bellies

 2. “Aromatherapy”- More Than Relaxing Scents

 3. Cooking with Essential Oils

Caitlin MacKinna, the founder of the Natural Remedies blog, is a licensed physical therapist, herbalist, and Reiki Master. She provides her thoughts and insights on home remedies and natural cures for common ailments & diseases and more on this simple and informative blog.

Posts that we love:

 1. 3 Easy Home Remedies for Colon Cleansing

 2. 25 Safer Alternatives to Store-Bought Cosmetics

 3. Drinking Beet Juice Can Help You Run Faster

Dr. Geo is a renowned research physician in the areas of holistic urology and men’s health issues, including prostate and testicular issues. His focus is on the behaviors, lifestyles, nutritional, naturopathic, and functional medicine approaches to helping you extend and enjoy your life.

Posts that we love:

 1. Supplements: How Much Do You Actually Need?

 2. 7 Things to Take for Flu and Cold Prevention

Natural Partners Wellness Blog is a beautifully designed blog, focusing on natural remedies, nutritional wellness, supplements, and healthy eating. Updated consistently, you will always find something new and interesting each time you stop by.

Pots that we love:

 1. Simply Healthy Dinner Sides

 2. Vitamin D in the Management of Asthma

 3. Chronic Inflammation? 5 Foods to Try Now

Natural Oil Mom knows all about how easy it can be to fall into the trap of eating a fat heavy, fast-food diet, but if you follow the content published on her blog, you will learn how to leave the fat behind and focus on healthy eating for you and your whole family (and a whole lot more!).

Posts that we love:

 1. Cilantro-Lime Rice

 2. Healthier, Dark Chocolate Toffee Brittle

 3. Instant Pot Oregano Chicken and Rice

Dr. Homeo: All About Homeopathy is a blog website created by Dr. Vikas Sharma, who has been a homeopathic physician for over the past 16 years, and his experience shows in his superior articles on how to treat almost every ailment you can imagine.

Posts that we love:

 1. Wonderful Homeopathic Remedies for Tinnitus

 2. How effective are Homeopathic Medicines for ADHD?

 3. Save your Kid from Adenoid Surgery – Homeopathic Medicines are the Best Bet

Created and maintained by the doctors of the Naturopathic Foundation’s Health Clinic in Ontario, Canada, they provide a deep insight into disease prevention and treatment, as well as offering plenty of fun and fascinating related articles.

Posts that we love:

 1. Oral Health: What is Oil Pulling?

 2. Is Your Acne Hormone Related? We can help.

 3. Tips For Soft Glowing Skin Throughout The Harsh Winter Months

The Ayurvedic Talk blog is everything related to Ayurveda, Yoga, and Holistic Life. An ever-growing compilation of ideas, news, and researches in the field of herbal medicine will help you to bring a natural balance to your life.

Posts that we love:

 1. Rosemary – the wonder herb for longevity

 2. Role of healing oils in Ayurvedic treatment

 3. Best Ayurvedic remedies to keep your allergies at bay

The eHealth Forum is an alternative medicine & health community, featuring member and doctor discussions ranging from a specific symptom to related conditions, treatment options, medication, side effects, diet, and emotional issues surrounding medical conditions. Get your questions answered today at the eHealth Forum.

Posts that we love:

 1. Alternative Medicine Forum

 2. Safe to start borage oil with factor V laiden?

 3. Cancer: Alcohol’s Dirty Little Secret?

Leisa Wheeler, naturopath, and raw food coach is the founder and director of Embracing Health, a business dedicated to bringing you health information that can change your life. Be prepared to learn tons about diet and nutrition, physical fitness, emotional release work, hands-on healing, meditation, self-development, and metaphysics.

Posts that we love:

 1. These ‘Safe’ Drugs Are Not Safe

 2. Fountain Of Youth Pill – Stop The Press!

 3. A High Fiber Diet Is The Key To Longevity

Who would have ever guessed that one of our Top 50 websites would be belonging to a documentary film, but the Numen Blog, produced in conjunction with the documentary movie Numen, really has tons of fascinating content about natural medicine, herbs, and sustainability. Oh, by the way, the movie is excellent too.

Posts that we love:

 1. Grow Your Own High Quality Herbal Medicine

 2. Domestic Herbs – Where Are They?

 3. How To Balance Quality And Sustainability In Sourcing Herbs

Good nutrition is vital. The Authentic Self Wellness blog will inspire you to start eating a diet full of nutrient-dense foods and includes content ranging from radio show episodes to product reviews, and even delicious recipes.

Posts that we love:

 1. Travel Tips: How to Stay Healthy on Vacation

 2. How to Stay Motivated to Eat a Healthy Diet

 3. How to Make Cranberry Almond Granola Bars with Naturally More

Run by a small collection of expert naturopathic physicians, you can always count on the ND Healthcare blog to offer lucid, and interesting content on the importance of naturopathic care and health conditions that can be helped with naturopathic treatments.

Posts that we love:

 1. Digesting The Holidays

 2. Why My Mom is Doing the Detox

 3. Vitamin C And Smoking

Online Holistic Health was created to provide a platform to present information related to natural health care as an alternative to our current healthcare system. Its purpose is to bring awareness to the public and provide individuals with the information necessary for them to regain their health, prevent illness and disease, and achieve overall optimal health. If you are interested in writing for OHH, you can submit samples of your work here.

Posts that we love:

 1. Health Benefits of Oranges!

 2. The Flow of Qi & Health

 3. No Need To Ban The Black Bean

Are there any natural medicine websites that you swear by, but don’t see on our list? Comment letting us know your favorites!

opengraph.title: Top 50 Natural Medicine Sites For Living a Healthy Life
opengraph.description: Here are the Top 50 Natural Medicine Sites For Living a Healthy Life. The Complete Herbal Guide was listed as one of the best herbal websites to go to...
